studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added COVID-19 pandemic benefits/risks evaluation and updated study procedures including local labs and drug shipment.
Introduced off-site phone visit options for subjects on stable long-term monotherapy.
Modified tumor assessment schedule and central review requirements following primary analysis.
Discontinuation of IDMC reviews following primary analysis.
Added reporting requirements for secondary primary malignancies and myeloid disorders.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To allow for procedure modification in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and confirm benefit-risk profile.
Primary analysis was completed on 03 June 2019, allowing for unblinding of the sponsor and reduction of central monitoring requirements.
To limit cumulative radiation exposure for patients with long-term disease control.
To align with the most recent version of the Statistical Analysis Plan.

studyChanges.afterText: every 12 weeks from last scan (not to exceed 24 weeks per investigator discretion)
studyChanges.summary: Updated tumor assessment schedule for subjects with durable disease control.
Changed status of Duration of Response (DOR) endpoint.

studyChanges.afterText: reporting of myelodysplastic syndrome, acute myeloid leukemia, or any secondary primary malignancy
studyChanges.summary: Added specific adverse events of special interest reporting requirements.

studyChanges.beforeText: Blinded/Unblinded TA MD and study teams
studyChanges.summary: Removed references to separate blinded/unblinded sponsor teams following primary analysis.

studyChanges.afterText: Modified schedule of assessments for safety monitoring and tumor assessment only
studyChanges.summary: Simplified procedures for subjects who discontinue therapy without progressive disease.
